issue.title: www.startpage.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.startpage.com/sp/search](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.startpage.com%2Fsp%2Fsearch) ### Comment > Startpage.com displays “Sponsored” ads in search results when AdGuard’s DNS filter is updated, even if the option to unblock search ads and self-promoting ads is disabled. > > Please refer to the three attached screenshots for details. > This issue appears to be related to the closed GitHub issue #162556. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/162556 > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Steps to Reproduce: > 1. Open startpage.com in Safari 26.0.1 (21622.1.22.11.15) on macOS Tahoe 26.0.1 (25A362). > 2. Search for any keyword (e.g., “lesser evil” — a snack company, or “RTX 5090”) as shown in the screenshots. > 3. Observe that “Sponsored” ads appear shortly after the search results load. > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Additional Notes: > - The issue occurs 100% of the time after performing basic troubleshooting, including: > 1. Turning the AdGuard Safari extension off and back on. > 2. Updating all loaded filters to their latest versions. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/3c1n2ljkf8w0o048wwgk48ogo8c8ow888hvgtxbn0w.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/sa1k34qf2sgk8osgsc48wksgowg4g4s69aj9ip7wg4.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5w6ztpyg5u880gk8cw004swwwscck8cibhgzif3k2o.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.17.3.2020 release System version: | `macOS Tahoe 26.0.1 (25A362)` Browser: | Safari Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320),
Disable cache for third-party requests,
Block third-party Authorization header

**Browser API**:
Block WebRTC,
Block Push API,
Block Location API,
Block Java

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Protect against DPI DNS filtering: | server: `Built-in AdGuard DNS-over-QUIC`

AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList

EasyList China Custom filters: | `N/A` Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled Userscripts: | `1. AdGuard Extra`
`2. AdGuard Popup Blocker`
`3. Web of Trust` Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | `DeArrow for YouTube, SponsorBlock for Safari, PayPal Honey, Noir - Dark Mode for Safari, UserScripts, Proton Pass for Safari, Hush Nag Blocker (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/hush-nag-blocker/id1544743900), StopTheMadness Pro (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/stopthemadness-pro/id6471380298), ` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=mac&product_version=2.17.3.2020+release&system_version=macOS+Tahoe+26.0.1+%2825A362%29&browser=safari&filters=2.11.101.3.17.118.204.225.251.4.123.14.18.19.250.207.122.22.21.20.241.208.255.256.257.239.15.104.7&custom_filters=N%252FA&dns_servers=Built-in+AdGuard+DNS-over-QUIC&userscripts=1.%2520AdGuard%2520Extra%250A2.%2520AdGuard%2520Popup%2520Blocker%250A3.%2520Web%2520of%2520Trust&dns.filters_enabled=false&dns.enabled=true&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=true&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.webrtc=true&stealth.push=true&stealth.location=true&stealth.java=true&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.hide_search_queries=true&stealth.DNT=true&stealth.x_client=true&stealth.dpi=true&stealth.third_party_cookies=180&stealth.first_party_cookies=4320&stealth.disable_third_party_cache=true&stealth.block_third_party_auth=true&stealth.block_trackers=true)

issue.title: www.startpage.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.startpage.com/sp/search](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.startpage.com%2Fsp%2Fsearch) ### Comment > Startpage.com displays “Sponsored” ads in search results when AdGuard’s DNS filter is updated, even if the option to unblock search ads and self-promoting ads is disabled. > > Please refer to the three attached screenshots for details. > This issue appears to be related to the closed GitHub issue #162556. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/162556 > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Steps to Reproduce: > 1. Open startpage.com in Safari 26.0.1 (21622.1.22.11.15) on macOS Tahoe 26.0.1 (25A362). > 2. Search for any keyword (e.g., “lesser evil” — a snack company, or “RTX 5090”) as shown in the screenshots. > 3. Observe that “Sponsored” ads appear shortly after the search results load. > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Additional Notes: > - The issue occurs 100% of the time after performing basic troubleshooting, including: > 1. Turning the AdGuard Safari extension off and back on. > 2. Updating all loaded filters to their latest versions. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

I guess that account is required to reproduce this issue, which I don't have. Could you please check if problem occurs with all modules disabled (I mean `Ad blocking`, `Tracking protection`, `Annoyance blocking`, `DNS protection` and `Firewall`? If so, please try to disable `Route traffic through AdGuard` option for `ZEN.COM` application in AdGuard `App management`.

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: I see it It is not annoying. I hope they will move it from the first main positions to the end.

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.startpage.com/sp/search](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.startpage.com%2Fsp%2Fsearch) ### Comment > Startpage.com displays “Sponsored” ads in search results when AdGuard’s DNS filter is updated, even if the option to unblock search ads and self-promoting ads is disabled. > > Please refer to the three attached screenshots for details. > This issue appears to be related to the closed GitHub issue #162556. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/162556 > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Steps to Reproduce: > 1. Open startpage.com in Safari 26.0.1 (21622.1.22.11.15) on macOS Tahoe 26.0.1 (25A362). > 2. Search for any keyword (e.g., “lesser evil” — a snack company, or “RTX 5090”) as shown in the screenshots. > 3. Observe that “Sponsored” ads appear shortly after the search results load. > > ⸻⸻⸻⸻ > > Additional Notes: > - The issue occurs 100% of the time after performing basic troubleshooting, including: > 1. Turning the AdGuard Safari extension off and back on. > 2. Updating all loaded filters to their latest versions. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not reproduced in Safari - I don't see that without AdGuard. However, I have the same in Chrome and it's blocked by AdGuard Base.
Which certificate did the browser use? You can check it in the Chrome address bar and also open [this link](https://adguard.com/test.html) to see how the app works.
Note that these filters are redundant.
```
AdGuard Mobile Ads
EasyList
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=ru.nskes.paysphera](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dru.nskes.paysphera) ### Comment > Реклама в приложении для оплаты ЖКХ "Платосфера", не помогает даже включение HTTPS-фильтрации для этого приложения, изначально HTTPS-фильтрация была для, него отключена, так как указано, что она может нарушить работу приложения. После включения HTTPS-фильирации реклама вида как на первом скриншоте пропала, но на следующий день снова появилась и больше не уходит, несмотря на то, что HTTPS-фильирация не отключалась. Реклама из второго скриншота (квадратные плитки вверху приложения) вообще не пропадала даже в первый день. Отловить эту рекламу в Adguard DNS Personal вручную мне не удалось, кроме того, у меня там установлены все фильтры без пометки "problematic" за исключением HaGeZi's URL Shortener Blocklist, HaGeZi's Allowlist Referral, HaGeZi's Anti-Piracy Blocklist, No Google, ShadowWhisperer's Dating List, но это тоже не сработало. ``` Username: @Symbiote2099 ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/hmzmnwp2njswo4kkgo4840oks4osw40lvgy9zqa7ls.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end. However, if the ads are shown, they can't be blocked, otherwise the app won't work. There might be a setting in the about the app that could disable the ads, but I see they removed it.
Another option is to open it via a browser.

Странно. Применения ваших правил в HAR не вижу.

Попробуйте заблокировать по одному:
`||yandex.com/ads/system/adsdk.js` - этот у вас почему-то не заблокирован.
`||yastatic.net/partner-code-bundles/*/vas-bundles/bundles-es2017/loader.bundle.js`
`||yastatic.net/partner-code-bundles/*/vas-bundles/bundles-es2017/ya-music-api.bundle.js`
